( Settlement deed for a property worth Rs. 3,73,000/-, dated 17.01.2026. Signed by:- Krishnakumari, wife of Mandla Lakshminarayana, aged 25, Chennaipalem village, Machavaram mandal, Palnadu district, Aadhar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX. Signed by:- Lakshminarayana, son of Mandla Kotaiah, aged 30, Chennaipalem village, Machavaram mandal, Palnadu district, Aadhar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX. Details:- You are my wife. Out of the love I have for you, I wish to transfer some property in your name without any kind of reward. I hereby settle to you this day the following Scheduled Property worth Rs. 3,73,000/-, which is my ancestral property and has been acquired by me by inheritance and has been registered in my name by the Gram Panchayat of Chennaipalem and is in my possession.

1. This property is not assigned by the Government and does not belong to the Endowment Department.
2. This property is not owned by the Government, its affiliated companies and the above entities are not mortgaged with any security.
.
3. What is the purpose of this deed? We agree to pay the cost of prosecution against us under Sections 27 and 67 of the Indian Stamp Act if it is found that any fact has been concealed in relation to this property, whether it is buildings, mango or coconut trees or plantations or precious minerals such as granite or other stones, missionary or fish pond.
4. I/We or my/our agents on my/our behalf have not made any unauthorized changes to this Schedule.
5. We confirm that the survey number, door number, measurements and details given in this document are correct. In case of any discrepancy, the Government of India shall issue the Indian Stamp Act, Andhra Pradesh Amendment Act I shall be fully liable for the strict action taken by the Registration Department in case of underpayment of stamp duty as amended under section 70(2) of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899. 6. We hereby declare that we have duly stated in the deed the full facts of the case, the consideration and the market value of the property, the stamp duty payable under the deed, and that if we fail to comply with the provisions of section 27, we shall be liable to be prosecuted under section 70 for the recovery of the said amount by imposing penalty and regular stamp duty from us under section 64 and 64/A. . We hereby enclose a plan with all the particulars necessary for the identification of the property in accordance with Section 21 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908, including the boundaries, door number, full address, etc. .
7. We have read and heard all the matters herein in full in the presence of the following witnesses,
and we hereby acknowledge that all these matters are as stated and written by us and that the scribe has written all that we have said.
.Sheet Endorsement

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL:CHENNAYAPALEM/ALL(0-0) W-B: 0-0 SURVEY:100/2 HOUSE: 4-48EXTENT: 72.6SQ.YdsBUILT: 400SQ. FTBoundires: [N]: bazar [S]house of mandla lakshmi[E]: house of mandlaVeeranjaneyulu [W]:house of mandla kotaiah

reportJson.assessmentNo: Old Assessment No. 648, New Assessment No. 200343000653

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 646 of 2026, dated 19/Jan/2026, executed by Mandla Lakshminarayan in favour of his Wife, Mandla Krishna Kumari towards the property admeasuring an extent of 72.6 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 4-48, Old Assessment No. 648, New Assessment No. 200343000653, comprised in survey number 100/2, situated in Chennayapalem Village & Grama Panchayati, Machavaram Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Piduguralla, is bounded as follows:

North by: Bazar
South by: House Of Mandla Lakshmi
East by: House Of Mandla Veeranjaneyulu
West by: House Of Mandla Kotaiah
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
